result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Morris Kasper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kenneth Morris Kasper is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kenneth Morris Kasper was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Morris Kasper

records.addlTxt:
AND ARRIAGNMENT 9:43 AM Defendant Kenneth Morris Kasper in court.  Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court for Kenneth Morris Kasper.  Attorney Chad C La Lor appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that defendant plead to Count 2 in 22CF62. Counts 1 and 3 along with 22FO164 and 22FO163 are dismissed. For Count 2, serve 5 days jail with credit for 4 days, time served and pay $250 fine plus court costs. Defendant pleads guilty. Attorney Johansen stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court orders for Count 2 in 22CF62, 5 days jail with credit for 4 days, time served and pay a $250 fine plus costs. Counts 1 and 3 along with 22FO163 and 22FO164 are dismissed.

records.addlTxt:
Calling cases 22CF62 for preliminary hearing, 22FO163, 22FO164 for STC 
10:30 AM Defendant Kenneth Morris Kasper not in court. Attorney Jamy Johansen appears.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Johansen has no information on non appearance.
State requests warrant, forf bail/bond, default on citations.
Attorney requests to hold off until the end of the day so he can track down client.
Court orders warrant, forf bail/bond, default on citations 60 days to pay.
State requests geographic restrictions of WI and St. Louis and Carlton Counties.

10:33 case recalled; Attorney Johansen appears with defendant kenneth Kasper.
Court questions late appearance.
Attorney indicates defendant was on second floor and didn't know where hearing was.  was in the courthouse on time.
State not opposed to vacating defaults of FO's, reinstating bond, can proceed with waiver.
Court-vacates the defaults, warrant, and forf of bail/bond.

  Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment.  Court reminds of bail/conditions.  Arraignment scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

03:42 PM Defendant Kenneth Morris Kasper in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker, special appearance.  Angela M Wilson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading.  Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Attorney requests preliminary hearing.
State-no significant criminal history, no failures to appear.  requesting 1500sb   No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Attorney-no objection; believes appropriate.  was out on sb during other cases and made all appearances.
COURT ORDERS- $1500SB   No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Court questions defendant on intent for Counsel. Defendant indicates he is going to apply with the public defender.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
